org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules

Class HarmonicRR3

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules.HarmonicRR3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReactionRule

    public class HarmonicRR3
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReactionRule
    This rule computes the degree of harmony that will be played after the current degree. It creates a temporary solution in which all the possible degrees are present. The created solution is identified with a Temporary object. It also creates a PickOneRR and a RythmeHRR.
    Here is how it works :
    It takes two reagents :
    • DegreeImpl _degree
    • SubSolution _barInCreationSolution
    The computeSelect is used, see the computeSelect and computeResult documentation for more informations

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.user.ReactionRule

        ReactionRule.Multiplicity

      • computeResult

        public java.lang.Object[] computeResult()
        It must not return _degree into the main solution !
        After a 1st degree, you can go :
        • On a 1nd degree on 10%
        • On a 2nd degree on 10%
        • On a 3rd degree on 10%
        • On a 4th degree on 25%
        • On a 5th degree on 30%
        • On a 6th degree on 15%


        ! _degree must be added to _barInCreationSolution !

        The computResult add a temporary solution into the main solution. To identify this solution, you must add a Temporary object into the solution. This object will be used later.

        It also add the _degree in the solution identified by a BarInCreation Object. It must also put back the BarInCreation object into _barInCreationSolution because, due to the reaction, it's no longer in _barInCreationSolution. Before adding the BarInCreation object, it's important to change it's state to RYTHMEHRR.


        Specified by:
        computeResult in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        a Solution identified by a HarmonicSol object with a proportional number of each possible degrees,
        a PickOneRR and a RythmeHRR.
        See Also:
        BarInCreation.BarInCreationState

      • computeSelect

        public boolean computeSelect()
        This method must succeed if :
        _barInCreationSolution has a valid BarInCreation element. This means that the state of the BarInCreation object is set to HARMONICRR
        && _degree.getValue() is equal to 1 (This is HarmonicRR1)
        Specified by:
        computeSelect in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        true if the present reagents are compatible with the reaction.

      • getMultiplicity

        public ReactionRule.Multiplicity getMultiplicity()
        This is an infinity-shot rule
        Specified by:
        getMultiplicity in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        the multiplicity of the reaction (ONE_SHOT or INFINITY_SHOT).
